message.content:
cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.CC 

Reasoning: The paper deals with the problem of maximizing a submodular set function subject to constraints, which is a classic problem in the field of discrete optimization (cs.DS). The use of greedy and local search algorithms suggests a focus on approximation algorithms and heuristics, which are also relevant to machine learning (cs.AI) and optimization (cs.LG). The mention of perturbation-stable instances and worst-case approximation guarantees suggests a focus on theoretical computer science (cs.IT) and complexity theory (cs.CC).
